DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Interleukin-12 may stimulate person 's white blood cell kill lymphoma cell . Monoclonal antibody , rituximab , locate cancer cell either kill deliver cancer-killing substance without harm normal cell . PURPOSE : Phase I trial study effectiveness interleukin-12 plus rituximab treating patient non-Hodgkin 's lymphoma .
DOC.brief_title: Interleukin-12 Plus Rituximab Treating Patients With Non-Hodgkin 's Lymphoma
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine optimal immunological dose interleukin-12 rituximab administer combination patient non-Hodgkin 's lymphoma . II . Determine toxicity associate regimen patient population . III . Assess pharmacodynamics regimen patient . IV . Document observe clinical response regimen patient . OUTLINE : This dose escalation study interleukin-12 . Patients receive rituximab IV day 1 , 8 , 15 , 22 . The first cohort patient receive interleukin-12 SC twice weekly begin day 29 . Subsequent cohort receive interleukin-12 SC twice weekly begin day 16 . Patients stable respond disease may continue treatment interleukin-12 twice weekly 24 week disease progression . Cohorts 6-9 patient receive escalate dos interleukin-12 optimal immunological dose determine . The optimal immunological dose define dose precede 2 6 2 9 patient experience dose limit toxicity dose maximal increase gamma interferon , inducible protein-10 ( IP-10 ) immune cell infiltration lymphoma ( whichever dose low ) . Following initial dose escalation , 2 additional cohort 6 patient receive fix dose interleukin-12 SC twice weekly begin day 2 . Patients follow every 3 month first year , every 6 month next 4 year disease progression . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A maximum 45 patient accrue study within 12-13 month .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Histologically confirm CD20+ Bcell nonHodgkin 's lymphoma No relapse intermediate high grade disease eligible bone marrow stem cell transplant Intermediate high grade disease must receive prior anthracycline contain regimen Low grade disease ( without prior therapy ) felt incurable standard therapy allow No CNS involvement lymphoma A new classification scheme adult nonHodgkin 's lymphoma adopt PDQ . The terminology `` indolent '' `` aggressive '' lymphoma replace former terminology `` low '' , `` intermediate '' , `` high '' grade lymphoma . However , protocol us former terminology . PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 18 Performance status : ECOG 01 Life expectancy : At least 12 week Hematopoietic : Absolute neutrophil count least 1,500/mm3 Platelet count least 75,000/mm3 Hemoglobin least 10 g/dL Hepatic : Bilirubin great 3 time upper limit normal ( ULN ) AST/ALT le 3 time ULN Renal : Creatinine great 2 time ULN Cardiovascular : No New York Heart Association class III IV heart disease No history angina Other : Not pregnant nursing Negative pregnancy test Fertile patient must use effective contraception HIV negative No uncontrolled infection No autoimmune relate phenomena No peptic ulcer disease PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : At least 12 month since prior rituximab No prior interleukin12 No concurrent immunotherapy Chemotherapy : See Disease Characteristics No prior fludarabine 2chlorodeoxyadenosine unless CD4 count normal Recovered prior chemotherapy No concurrent chemotherapy Endocrine therapy : No concurrent steroid therapy Radiotherapy : No concurrent radiotherapy Surgery : Not specify
